skill.name: commit-prepare
skill.description: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, commit this, commit message, ready to commit, stage and commit
skill.summary: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, co...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only provides guidelines for generating conventional commit messages through git commands. No network, filesystem, or environment access beyond standard git operations required for commit message preparation.

content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automatically analyzes staged changes and generates standardized commit messages following the conventional commits format. It handles feature additions, bug fixes, documentation updates, and breaking changes with proper type detection and formatting.
actual_capabilities: Analyze staged and unstaged git changes to understand modifications
Determine commit type (feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, chore, perf, ci)
Generate conventional commit messages with proper subject, body, and footer
Handle breaking changes with appropriate footer notation
Review files for secrets before committing
Provide multi-line commit messages with proper formatting
limitations: Does not automatically stage files - requires user confirmation
Does not execute git commands without user approval
Does not push commits - only prepares messages
Relies on user to provide context for complex changes

use_cases.title: Standardize team commits
use_cases.description: Generate consistent, descriptive commit messages across your team following conventional commits standards.

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Create professional commit messages that meet project contribution guidelines and improve project history readability.

use_cases.title: Automate release notes
use_cases.description: Generate commits with proper semantic versioning to enable automated changelog and release note generation.

prompt_templates.title: Breaking change
prompt_templates.prompt: ready to commit - this is a breaking change

prompt_templates.title: Complex multi-file
prompt_templates.prompt: what should I commit for these staged changes

output: Implement automatic token refresh when access token expires.
Includes retry logic with exponential backoff.

best_practices: Review the suggested commit message before confirming execution
Use descriptive scopes to indicate which component changed
Break complex changes into multiple logical commits when possible
anti_patterns: Using generic messages like 'fix bug' or 'update code'
Skipping commit message verification before execution
Committing large binary files without warning

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It activates on keywords like commit, prepare commit, or ready to commit.

faq.question: What conventional commit types are supported?
faq.answer: feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, perf, chore, ci, and style. Each has specific use cases defined in the skill instructions.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically stage files?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes staged changes but asks for user confirmation before staging additional files or committing.

faq.question: Is my code and commit history safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads git status and diff information. All commit actions require explicit user approval before execution.

faq.question: How does this handle breaking changes?
faq.answer: The skill detects breaking changes and generates messages with the '!' notation and a BREAKING CHANGE footer for documentation.

faq.question: Can I use this with any git hosting service?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill works with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and any git repository. It uses standard git commands locally.
